body_html: @inflation I've tried changing the line result = var.eval({inp: x1, is_training: True}, sess) to result = var.eval({inp: x1, is_training: tf.condtant(True)}, sess) even to result = var.eval({inp: x1, is_training: tf.constant(True, dtype=tf.bool)}, sess), but both possibilities end up with InvalidArgumentError:.
body_text: @inflation I've tried changing the line result = var.eval({inp: x1, is_training: True}, sess) to result = var.eval({inp: x1, is_training: tf.condtant(True)}, sess) even to result = var.eval({inp: x1, is_training: tf.constant(True, dtype=tf.bool)}, sess), but both possibilities end up with InvalidArgumentError:.
body: @inflation I've tried changing the line `result = var.eval({inp: x1, is_training: True}, sess)` to `result = var.eval({inp: x1, is_training: tf.condtant(True)}, sess)` even to `result = var.eval({inp: x1, is_training: tf.constant(True, dtype=tf.bool)}, sess)`, but both possibilities end up with `InvalidArgumentError:`.
